docs.lead_paragraph: People infected with the AIDS virus live longer if they are in stable sexual relationships, a new study reports. The findings, which also show a slower progression of the disease for people in these relationships, are in keeping with past studies that have established links between emotional health and physical health.
docs.abstract: Dr Heiner C Bucher of Basel Institute for Clinical Epidemiology (Switzerland) leads study on effects of stable sexual relationships on life expectancy of AIDS patients; finds those individuals infected with AIDS virus who have someone significant in their lives maintain healthier life styles and show slower progression of disease; study is published in BMJ, British medical journal (S)
